Starting in the last week March/ first week April, 2020, the Ministry of Health of the Republic of Belarus has posted the recommendations which include:  - Do not go out of the house unless it is particularly necessary (going to work, buying food and medicines, receiving medical and other vital services).  - Do not leave home to visit places that are not vital (libraries, museums, cinemas, theaters, and other public places). Children may only go out with the family. Arrange to walk pets alone.  - Refrain from attending classes in clubs, sports clubs, gyms, even with a minimum number of participants. In case you continue sports activities, make sure that the group size does not exceed 5 people and that a distance of 1.5-2 m between people is maintained during the activities.  - Communicate with others remotely by means of communication. Do not visit or host friends and family members who do not live with you.  - The following measures can be used to reduce the need to leave the house: remote work, video calls and conference calls; Each employer must ensure that a distance of 1-1.5 meters between employees' workplaces, personal hygiene and environmental (room) hygiene is maintained;  - Choose delivery services - only to the doorstep of the apartment (house, office);  - If you go out of the house in situations where it is necessary (see point 1), it is necessary to reduce contact with other people and keep a 1.5 - 2 meter distance from each other.    Web sources:    https://web.archive.org/web/20210429171621/http://minzdrav.gov.by/upload/dadvfiles/letter/%D0%9F%D0%B0%D0%BC%D1%8F%D1%82%D0%BA%D0%B0%20%D0%BF%D0%BE%20%D1%81%D0%BE%D1%86%D0%B8%D0%B0%D0%BB%D1%8C%D0%BD%D0%BE%D0%BC%D1%83%20%D0%B4%D0%B8%D1%81%D1%82%D0%B0%D0%BD%D1%86%D0%B8%D1%80%D0%BE%D0%B2%D0%B0%D0%BD%D0%B8%D1%8E.pdf    https://web.archive.org/web/20210515074807/https://minzdrav.gov.by/ru/dlya-belorusskikh-grazhdan/COVID-19/

On April 8, 2020, the Ministry of Health and the Minsk City Executive Committee posted social distancing policies, including:  - to walk your pets alone   - elevators should be used alone  - in a private car, there must be only family members living in the same house in the cabin. (An exception is the need to accompany a person in an emergency situation)  - face masks were made mandatory in all enclosed public spaces.   - the legal requirements for business owners to maintain physical distance for customers (of at least 1.5m and post information about the need to maintain a safe distance)  - refrain from attending classes in clubs, sports clubs, gyms, even with a minimum number of participants. In case you continue sports activities, make sure that the group size does not exceed 5 people. Continuing from April 8, 2020, the Ministry of Health and the Minsk City Executive Committee posted social distancing policies, including:  - to walk your pets alone   - elevators should be used alone  - in a private car, there must be only family members living in the same house in the cabin. (An exception is the need to accompany a person in an emergency situation)  - face masks were made mandatory in all enclosed public spaces.   - the legal requirements for business owners to maintain physical distance for customers (of at least 1.5m and post information about the need to maintain a safe distance)  - refrain from attending classes in clubs, sports clubs, gyms, even with a minimum number of participants. In case you continue sports activities, make sure that the group size does not exceed 5 people. On 5 November, Mogilev became the first city in Belarus to introduce compulsory use of facial masks in public places.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201210143542/https://news.tut.by/society/706859.html    On 5 November, Mogilev became the first city in Belarus to introduce compulsory use of facial masks in public places.    On 9 November, compulsory use of facial masks was introduced in Gomel Region.    According to the 11 November Ministry of Health decree, PCR-based tests were no longer conducted for first-level contacts with an asymptomatic infection course.    On 12 November, compulsory use of facial masks was introduced in Minsk. As of date, besides Minsk, Gomel Region and Mogilev, such measure was reported to had been employed in Babruisk, Asipovichy, Klichev, Krichev, Chavusy District, Cherykaw District, Polotsk District and Novopolotsk.    On 16 November, compulsory use of facial masks was introduced in Vitebsk Region.    On 18 November, compulsory use of facial masks was introduced in Brest Region.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201210143604/https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/COVID-19_pandemic_in_Belarus
No change in current policy    https://web.archive.org/web/20201210134154/https://www.covid19healthsystem.org/countries/belarus/livinghit.aspx?Section=1.2+Physical+distancing&Type=Section

The land border crossings and railroad border crossings for regular border traffic for entry into Belarus for third-country nationals remain closed. This concerns entry by land from the countries Lithuania, Latvia, Poland and Ukraine. Entry via airports is possible, including 10-day isolation, etc. as mentioned in earlier coding entries.

Starting in the last week March/ first week April, 2020, the Ministry of Health of the Republic of Belarus has posted the recommendations which include:  - Do not go out of the house unless it is particularly necessary (going to work, buying food and medicines, receiving medical and other vital services).  - Do not leave home to visit places that are not vital (libraries, museums, cinemas, theaters, and other public places). Children may only go out with the family. Arrange to walk pets alone.  - Refrain from attending classes in clubs, sports clubs, gyms, even with a minimum number of participants. In case you continue sports activities, make sure that the group size does not exceed 5 people and that a distance of 1.5-2 m between people is maintained during the activities.  - Communicate with others remotely by means of communication. Do not visit or host friends and family members who do not live with you.  - The following measures can be used to reduce the need to leave the house: remote work, video calls and conference calls; Each employer must ensure that a distance of 1-1.5 meters between employees' workplaces, personal hygiene and environmental (room) hygiene is maintained;  - Choose delivery services - only to the doorstep of the apartment (house, office);  - If you go out of the house in situations where it is necessary (see point 1), it is necessary to reduce contact with other people and keep a 1.5 - 2 meter distance from each other.    Web sources:    https://web.archive.org/web/20210429171621/http://minzdrav.gov.by/upload/dadvfiles/letter/%D0%9F%D0%B0%D0%BC%D1%8F%D1%82%D0%BA%D0%B0%20%D0%BF%D0%BE%20%D1%81%D0%BE%D1%86%D0%B8%D0%B0%D0%BB%D1%8C%D0%BD%D0%BE%D0%BC%D1%83%20%D0%B4%D0%B8%D1%81%D1%82%D0%B0%D0%BD%D1%86%D0%B8%D1%80%D0%BE%D0%B2%D0%B0%D0%BD%D0%B8%D1%8E.pdf    https://web.archive.org/web/20210515074807/https://minzdrav.gov.by/ru/dlya-belorusskikh-grazhdan/COVID-19/

Internal movement remains allowed. No new income support announced. Also, Prime Minister Roman Golovchenko said that the government did not see a slowdown in economic activity in Belarus amidst the second wave of COVID-19 and the social commitments of the state were not only fulfilled, but also over-fulfilled as the average salary reached Br1,300.     “The 8.9% increase in real household income is another testimony to the efficient economic performance,”    “Despite the difficult situation our economy is performing quite well, much better than the economies of many of our neighbors, including the economically stronger ones. In 2020, Belarus signed a contract for the supply of 170,000 doses of the Sputnik V vaccine. According the the official russian website of the Sputnik vaccine, one dose will cost slightly less than USD 10.00 which is why I decided to calculate the investment in the sense of doses ordered * 10.00$.   Also, it is important to mention that the exact price might differ as Belarus will be producing Sputnik vaccines on its own later in 2021 so the exact price/investment might differ.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210127141659/https://www.belarus.by/en/press-center/press-release/vaccination-of-frontline-health-workers-launched-in-belarus_i_0000124059.html    http://web.archive.org/web/20210127141325/https://sputnikvaccine.com/newsroom/pressreleases/the-cost-of-one-dose-will-be-less-than-10-for-international-markets/    Kirill Dmitriev, CEO of the Russian Direct Investment Fund (RDIF): “Today, Belarus has become the first country to start mass vaccination with Sputnik V. The next stage of cooperation between the RDIF and partners will be the start the vaccine production in Belarus, which will significantly simplify logistics, speed up the rate of vaccination and will prevent the spread of the disease," he concluded.    I did, however, not find any information on specific investment amounts or similar.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210111111232/https://eng.belta.by/society/view/belarus-begins-mass-vaccination-against-covid-19-with-russian-sputnik-v-136230-2020/

No new income support announced. Also, Prime Minister Roman Golovchenko said that the government did not see a slowdown in economic activity in Belarus amidst the second wave of COVID-19 and the social commitments of the state were not only fulfilled, but also over-fulfilled as the average salary reached Br1,300.     “The 8.9% increase in real household income is another testimony to the efficient economic performance,”    “Despite the difficult situation our economy is performing quite well, much better than the economies of many of our neighbors, including the economically stronger ones. According to preliminary estimates, our gross domestic product this year will be at least as big as 99% of last year's. This is the main economic outcome. It is very encouraging that the manufacturing industry has bounced back in recent months,”    “Even when the whole world is struggling through the coronavirus second wave, we do not see a slowdown in economic activity in our country so far,”    https://web.archive.org/web/20201228095057/https://eng.belta.by/economics/view/pm-no-economic-slowdown-in-belarus-amidst-coronavirus-second-wave-136198-2020/    Considering the official stand of the Belarus' government regarding Covid-19, new financial/economic/fiscal measures seem unlikely within the upcoming months at least.

Continuing from April 8, 2020, the Ministry of Health and the Minsk City Executive Committee posted social distancing policies, including:  - to walk your pets alone   - elevators should be used alone  - in a private car, there must be only family members living in the same house in the cabin. In case you continue sports activities, make sure that the group size does not exceed 5 people. Starting in the last week March/ first week April, 2020, the Ministry of Health of the Republic of Belarus has posted the recommendations which include:  - Do not go out of the house unless it is particularly necessary (going to work, buying food and medicines, receiving medical and other vital services).  - Do not leave home to visit places that are not vital (libraries, museums, cinemas, theaters, and other public places). Children may only go out with the family. Arrange to walk pets alone.  - Refrain from attending classes in clubs, sports clubs, gyms, even with a minimum number of participants. In case you continue sports activities, make sure that the group size does not exceed 5 people and that a distance of 1.5-2 m between people is maintained during the activities.  - Communicate with others remotely by means of communication. Do not visit or host friends and family members who do not live with you.  - The following measures can be used to reduce the need to leave the house: remote work, video calls and conference calls; Each employer must ensure that a distance of 1-1.5 meters between employees' workplaces, personal hygiene and environmental (room) hygiene is maintained;  - Choose delivery services - only to the doorstep of the apartment (house, office);  - If you go out of the house in situations where it is necessary (see point 1), it is necessary to reduce contact with other people and keep a 1.5 - 2 meter distance from each other.    Web sources:    https://web.archive.org/web/20210429171621/http://minzdrav.gov.by/upload/dadvfiles/letter/%D0%9F%D0%B0%D0%BC%D1%8F%D1%82%D0%BA%D0%B0%20%D0%BF%D0%BE%20%D1%81%D0%BE%D1%86%D0%B8%D0%B0%D0%BB%D1%8C%D0%BD%D0%BE%D0%BC%D1%83%20%D0%B4%D0%B8%D1%81%D1%82%D0%B0%D0%BD%D1%86%D0%B8%D1%80%D0%BE%D0%B2%D0%B0%D0%BD%D0%B8%D1%8E.pdf    https://web.archive.org/web/20210515074807/https://minzdrav.gov.by/ru/dlya-belorusskikh-grazhdan/COVID-19/

This may be one reason Belarus also outperformed most of Europe in terms of mass testing during the first four months of the pandemic. While many countries were reluctant to carry out extensive testing, according to the state owned news agency BelTA, testing in Belarus started as early as 23 January. Most kits were donated or purchased from China and Russia2 using government funds and donations from companies3 and ordinary citizens.4 The country stepped up testing in early April,5 developing its own rapid testing kits6 and switching to the use of domestically produced reagents for polymerase chain reaction testing in May.7 According to government information, there are now 32 laboratories processing samples across the country and testing is widespread in hospitals as well as from GPs.  http://web.archive.org/web/20210413102919/https://www.bmj.com/content/370/bmj.m3543

No new policies but continuing from 20 December, the government of Belarus has had exit controls at its land borders. No one can leave Belarus by a land border unless they have a valid exemption as set out by the Council of Ministers. Entering Belarus through the land border is only possible for those BNs who have temporary or permanent residency in Belarus. It also appears to be a closure for incoming migration: ex. Land borders are currently closed to U.S. citizens.     Flights continue to operate in and out of Minsk National Airport as normal. Incoming from foreign countries must quarantine.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210502220159/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/belarus/entry-requirements  https://web.archive.org/web/20210515094618/https://by.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/

Continuing from April 8, 2020, the Ministry of Health and the Minsk City Executive Committee posted social distancing policies, including:  - to walk your pets alone   - elevators should be used alone  - in a private car, there must be only family members living in the same house in the cabin. (An exception is the need to accompany a person in an emergency situation)  - face masks were made mandatory in all enclosed public spaces.   - the legal requirements for business owners to maintain physical distance for customers (of at least 1.5m and post information about the need to maintain a safe distance)  - refrain from attending classes in clubs, sports clubs, gyms, even with a minimum number of participants. In case you continue sports activities, make sure that the group size does not exceed 5 people.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210524130504/https://www.osac.gov/Content/Report/b390eadd-327a-4bde-9325-188bcb195547

The Ministry of Health of the Republic of Belarus recommends working from home where possible and instituting increased sanitisation procedures.     "2.1.2. If possible and with the written consent of the employee, the organization of remote work, the use of a flexible work schedule. The maximum possible number of employees should be transferred to remote work in compliance with the recommended measures."    "It is recommended to carry out disinfection using disinfectants approved for use for these purposes by the Ministry of Health of the Republic of Belarus, according to a regime effective against viruses, in accordance with the manufacturer's instructions (hereinafter -  disinfectants) of the contact surfaces of vehicles that transport workers after each trip.  A similar procedure is applied when carrying out business trips in the Republic of Belarus.  2.1.10. It is advisable to preferentially use non-contact door openers, light switches, and sanitary equipment.   2.1.11. Providing a minimum monthly supply of disinfectants and antiseptics, protective equipment; constant control over the timely replenishment of stocks and compliance with the standards for the provision of workers with protective equipment.  2.1.12. Ensuring a safe drinking regime for workers (equipping with drinking water coolers and disposable cups, or bottled water in a small package).   2.1.13. Allocation, if necessary, of separate rooms for storing personal and work clothes of employees"    http://web.archive.org/web/20210705133454/http://minzdrav.gov.by/ru/dlya-belorusskikh-grazhdan/COVID-19/metodicheskie-rekomendatsii-po-profilaktike-covid-19-v-organizatsiyakh.php

Inter-state and inter-city travel is allowed within Belarus.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210911014446/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/507271/belarus-authorities-maintaining-covid-19-related-international-travel-and-domestic-restrictions-as-of-july-28-update-11  http://web.archive.org/web/20210911012706/https://by.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/

Non-resident travelers are banned from entering via land travel. Non-resident travelers can enter via air travel, but must produce a negative pre-departure test result. Travelers from high-risk countries must self-isolate for 10 days upon arrival.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210911014446/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/507271/belarus-authorities-maintaining-covid-19-related-international-travel-and-domestic-restrictions-as-of-july-28-update-11  http://web.archive.org/web/20210911012706/https://by.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
Income support is provided via the national Targeted Social Assistance System    http://web.archive.org/web/20210911022848/https://ewsdata.rightsindevelopment.org/files/documents/00/WB-P174400.pdf
Relief is mainly restricted to the public sector.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210911023338/https://www.ebrd.com/belarus.html

EU, IOM and the State Border Committee jointly rolled out a public information campaign that provides updated Covid-19 information and measures in Belarus.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210911023626/https://rovienna.iom.int/news/iom-supports-covid-19-information-campaign-belarus-borders

Tests can be obtained at the airport or health clinics in various cities. It may take a while to schedule a test, but results are typically available within 72 hours.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210911023825/https://by.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
No change since last update.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210911023825/https://by.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
No change since last update.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210911023825/https://by.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
Masks are required in airplanes and boarding areas, but not on public transport.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210911023825/https://by.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/

Foreign travelers, short-term residents, permanent residents and citizens can get vaccinated. Vaccines used: Sputnik V and Vero Cell    http://web.archive.org/web/20210911023825/https://by.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
